ANU.name: Nicolò Malagutti
interest: Modelling and control of physiological systems.Sleep medicine Technology-assisted delivery of medicines. Medical applications of engineering. Medical devices.Engineering Education
ANU.biography: Nicolo holds a Bachelor and Master Degree in Biomedical Engineering from Politecnico di Milano (Milan, Italy) and a Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering from the Australian National University (Canberra, Australia).

publication.title: Particle filter-based robust adaptive control for closed-loop administration of sodium nitroprusside
publication.source: Journal of Computational Surgery, vol. 1, no. 8, pp. 19pp

publication.title: Robust control design for automatic regulation of blood pressure
publication.source: IET Control Theory and Applications, vol. 7, no. 3, pp. 387-396

publication.title: n adaptive multi-controller architecture using particle filtering
publication.source: 2nd Australian Control Conference (AUCC 2012), Engineers Australia, USA, pp. 392-398

publication.title: Robust Multiple-Model Adaptive Control System for Automatic Delivery of a Vasoactive Drug
publication.source: IASTED International Conference on Biomedical Engineering (BioMed 2012), Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE Inc), Innsbruck Austria, pp. 73-79

publication.title: n approach to controlled drug infusion via tracking of the time-varying dose-response
publication.source: IEEE International Conference of the Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBS 2012), ed. Michael C. K. Khoo; Gert Cauwenberghs; James Weiland, Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE Inc), Piscataway, New Jersey, pp. 3539 - 3542

publication.title: Improved robust performance in a system for automatic administration of a vasoactive drug
publication.source: International Conference on Bio-inspired Systems and Signal Processing (BIOSIGNALS 2012), Springer, Vilamoura Portugal, pp. 282-290

publication.title: Safety issues in adaptive control systems for automatic administration of vasoactive drugs
publication.source: IFAC World Congress 2011, ed. S. Bittanti, A. Cenedese, S. Zampieri, International Federation of Automatic Control (IFAC), Unknown, pp. 4167-4172
